revision.text:
{{for|the skier|Justin Long (skier)}} {{Infobox person |name = Justin Long |image = File:Justin Long TIFF 2011.jpg |caption = Long at the 2011 [[Toronto International Film Festival]] |birth_name = Justin Jacob Long |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|06|02}} |birth_place = [[Fairfield, Connecticut]], U.S. |alma_mater = [[Vassar College]] |occupation = Actor, comedian, humorist |yearsactive = 1999–present |partner = [[Lauren Mayberry]] (2016–present) |parents = [[R. James Long]]
Wendy Lesniak |website = }} '''Justin Jacob Long'''{{cite web | url = http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/justin-long/bio/159557/| title= Justin Long |publisher= [[TV Guide|TVGuide.com]] |accessdate=September 30, 2015}} (born June 2, 1978) is an American actor, comedian and humorist known for roles in such films as ''[[Jeepers Creepers (2001 film)|Jeepers Creepers]]'' (2001), ''[[Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story|Dodgeball]]'' (2004), ''[[Accepted]]'' (2006), ''[[Alvin and the Chipmunks (film)|Alvin and the Chipmunks]]'' (2007), ''[[Live Free or Die Hard]]'' (2007), ''[[Alpha and Omega (film)|Alpha and Omega]]'' (2010), ''[[Tusk (2014 film)|Tusk]]'' (2014) and ''[[Comet (film)|Comet]]'' (2014). He played Warren P. Cheswick on the [[NBC]] TV series ''[[Ed (TV series)|Ed]]'' and appeared with [[John Hodgman]] in TV commercials for [[Apple Inc.|Apple's]] "[[Get a Mac]]" advertising campaign. ==Early life== Long was born the middle son of three boys in [[Fairfield, Connecticut]], to father [[R. James Long]], a [[philosophy]] and [[Latin]] [[professor]] at [[Fairfield University]], and mother, Wendy Lesniak,{{cite web|url=http://www.moviesonline.ca/movienews_12217.html |title=Justin Long Interview, Die Hard 4 - MoviesOnline |publisher=Moviesonline.ca |accessdate=2010-03-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100906081339/http://www.moviesonline.ca/movienews_12217.html |archivedate=2010-09-06 |df= }} a former actress who has mostly appeared on stage.{{cite web|title=Justin Long biography|url=http://www.buddytv.com/info/justin-long-info.aspx|publisher=Buddytv|accessdate=21 September 2014}} His maternal grandmother was of [[Sicilian-American|Sicilian]] descent.{{cite web|last=Murray|first=Rebecca|url=http://movies.about.com/od/accepted/a/acceptdjl080806_2.htm|title=Justin Long Talks About The Sasquatch Dumpling Gang and Strange Wilderness|work=[[About.com]]|accessdate=2010-07-01}} Long had a "kind of conservative" [[Catholic Church|Roman Catholic]] upbringing.{{cite web|last=Topel|first=Fred|url=http://www.cinemablend.com/new/Interview-Justin-Long-3173.html|title=Interview: Justin Long|work=Cinema Blend|quote =My family is Roman Catholic and kind of conservative...|date=2006-08-14|accessdate=2010-03-22}}{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-465952/Q--A-Die-Hards-Justin-Long.html|title=Q & A with Die Hard's Justin Long|publisher=[[Daily Mail]]|date=2007-07-03|quote = I grew up in a Catholic, conservative family|accessdate=2010-10-19|first=|last=|location=London}} His older brother, Damian, is a local stage actor, teacher, and [[theatre director]] at [[Weston High School (Connecticut)|Weston High School]].{{cite web|title=Justin Long- Biography|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/justin-long/bio/159557|publisher=[[TV Guide]]|accessdate=21 May 2013}} Long attended [[Fairfield College Preparatory School]], a [[Society of Jesus|Jesuit]] school, and [[Vassar College]], where he was a member of the [[sketch comedy]] group Laughingstock and starred in several plays, including ''[[Butterflies Are Free (play)|Butterflies Are Free]]''. ==Career== [[File:JustinLong07TIFF.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Long at the [[2007 Toronto International Film Festival]]]] Long's film credits include ''[[Idiocracy]]'', ''[[Waiting... (film)|Waiting...]]'', ''[[Jeepers Creepers (2001 film)|Jeepers Creepers]]'', ''[[DodgeBall: A True Underdog Story]]'', ''[[The Break-Up]]'', ''[[Crossroads (2002 film)|Crossroads]]'', ''[[Galaxy Quest]]'', ''[[Dreamland (2006 film)|Dreamland]]'' and ''[[Live Free or Die Hard]]''. He was also a regular on the [[NBC]] TV series ''[[Ed (TV series)|Ed]]'' (2000–04), playing socially awkward Warren P. Cheswick. He voiced the character of Alvin in ''[[Alvin and the Chipmunks (film)|Alvin and the Chipmunks]]'', ''[[Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Squeakquel]]'', ''[[Alvin and the Chipmunks: Chipwrecked]]'', and ''[[Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip]]''.{{cite web|last1=Kroll|first1=Justin|title=Tony Hale Joins ‘Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip’ (EXCLUSIVE)|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/news/tony-hale-alvin-and-the-chipmunks-the-road-chip-1201431279/|website=Variety|accessdate=March 14, 2015}} He also played the main character in the comedy film ''[[Accepted]]'' (2006). Long made a guest appearance in the [[Documentary film|documentary]], ''[[Wild West Comedy Show: 30 Days & 30 Nights – Hollywood to the Heartland|Wild West Comedy Show]]'' (2006). In 2007, he co-starred with [[Bruce Willis]] as a "[[White hat (computer security)|white-hat hacker]]" in ''[[Live Free or Die Hard]]''{{cite web|url=http://www.cinemablend.com/new/Mac-Computer-And-Maggie-Q-For-Die-Hard-4-3468.html |title=Mac Computer And Maggie Q For Die Hard 4 |publisher=Cinemablend.com |date=2006-09-22 |accessdate=2010-03-22}} and had a role in the comedy ''[[The Sasquatch Gang]]''. Long is known for his depiction of a [[Macintosh|Mac]] in [[Apple Inc.|Apple's]] "[[Get a Mac]]" [[Advertising campaign|campaign]]. The campaign featured commercials in which Long as a Mac and [[John Hodgman]] as a [[Personal computer|PC]] engaged in playful banter about "the strengths of the Mac platform and weaknesses of the PC platform."[https://web.archive.org/web/20060820204934/http://www.latimes.com/news/custom/showcase/la-ca-long23jul23,0,1268414.story?track=tottext McNamara, Mary. "Not Strictly Commercial"]. ''[[Los Angeles Times]]''. July 23, 2006. Long also had a small role in the comedy film ''[[Zack and Miri Make a Porno]]'' (2008), where he plays Brandon St. Randy, a [[Homosexuality|gay]] [[Pornographic film actor|porn star]]. In 2009, he starred in ''[[He's Just Not That into You (film)|He's Just Not That into You]]'' along with co-star [[Ginnifer Goodwin]] and ''[[After.Life]]'' opposite [[Liam Neeson]] and [[Christina Ricci]]. He also provided the voice of Humphrey in ''[[Alpha and Omega (film)|Alpha and Omega]]'' (2010), starring with [[Hayden Panettiere]]. Also in 2010, Long starred in the comedy film ''[[Going the Distance (2010 film)|Going the Distance]]'' with [[Drew Barrymore]]. He was cast as a one-armed Civil War veteran in Robert Redford's ''[[The Conspirator]]''.{{cite web|author=Pics and Justin Long for Redford's Conspirator |url=http://www.newsinfilm.com/2009/10/16/pictures-and-justin-long-for-redfords-conspirator |title=Pics and Justin Long for Redford's Conspirator |publisher=News in Film |date=2009-10-16 |accessdate=2010-03-22 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100415003124/http://www.newsinfilm.com/2009/10/16/pictures-and-justin-long-for-redfords-conspirator/ |archivedate=2010-04-15 |df= }} Long read the [[audiobook]] version of [[Judy Blume]]'s ''[[Then Again, Maybe I Won't]]'' and [[Stephen King]]'s ''[[Everything's Eventual]]''. From July 7–18, 2010, he appeared in a production of ''Samuel J. and K.'' at the Williamstown Theatre Festival.{{cite web|url=http://www.wtfestival.org/2010/samueljandk |title=''Samuel J. and K'' appearance |publisher=Wtfestival.org |accessdate=2013-07-25 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140501050918/http://www.wtfestival.org/2010/samueljandk |archivedate=2014-05-01 |df= }} On August 16, 2010, he co-hosted ''[[WWE Raw]]'' with ''Going the Distance'' co-stars [[Charlie Day]] and [[Jason Sudeikis]] at the [[Staples Center]] in Los Angeles.{{cite web|url=http://www.wwe.com/shows/raw/special/allspecialguesthosts/ |title=Raw Special Guest Stars - August 16, 2010: The Cast of 'Going the Distance' |publisher=Wwe.com |accessdate=2013-07-25}} In 2014 he starred in the independent love drama ''[[Comet (film)|Comet]]'', which he and his co-star [[Emmy Rossum]] also produced. ==Personal life== He had a relationship with [[Drew Barrymore]],{{cite web |title=Justin Long Takes Drew Barrymore Home to Meet the Parents |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/1,,20162631,00.html |accessdate=2008-09-07 |date=2007-11-28 |work=[[People (magazine)|People]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425121527/http://www.people.com/people/article/1,,20162631,00.html |archivedate=2016-04-25 |df= }} but they broke up in July 2008.{{cite news |title=Drew Barrymore and Justin Long end relationship |url=http://www.foxnews.com/wires/2008Jul08/0,4670,PeopleBarrymoreLong,00.html |accessdate=2008-09-09 |date=2008-07-08|publisher=[[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox News.com]]}} He also dated [[Amanda Seyfried]] from mid-2013{{cite news|url=http://www.vogue.com/13257748/amanda-seyfried-ted-2-the-way-we-get-by-june-2015-cover/ | title=Amanda Seyfried Talks Family, ''Ted 2'', and Finding Love on Instagram| date=May 18, 2015 | work=[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]| publisher= [[Condé Nast]] | first=Jonathan | last=Van Meter|accessdate= September 30, 2015 | archivedate= September 6, 2015 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150906092932/http://www.vogue.com/13257748/amanda-seyfried-ted-2-the-way-we-get-by-june-2015-cover/ | deadurl=no}} for two years, breaking up in September 2015.{{cite news|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/amanda-seyfried-and-justin-long-split-after-two-years-details-2015299|title=Amanda Seyfried and Justin Long Split After Dating for Two Years: Details|work=Us Weekly|date=29 September 2015|accessdate=11 December 2015}} He began dating [[Lauren Mayberry]], lead singer of the Scottish synth-pop band [[CHVRCHES]], in 2016.{{Citation needed|date=August 2018}} Long endorsed Senator [[Bernie Sanders]] for [[President of the United States|President]] in the [[United States presidential election, 2016|2016 U.S. presidential election]].{{cite tweet |author = Justin Long |user = justinlong |number = 614837631239757824 |title=We're on a roll, America! Next stop: classism + overturning #CitizensUnited by supporting @SenSanders. #SummerOfEquality |date=27 Jun 2015 }} ==Filmography== [[File:Justin Long.jpg|thumb|right|(left-right) [[Jonah Hill]], Long, and [[Blake Lively]] promoting ''[[Accepted]]'' at [[San Diego Comic-Con International|Comic-Con]] in 2006]] ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Fox Show]]'' | Zack | Episode: "Changes" |- | 2014 | ''[[TripTank]]'' | Camera Man / Andrew (voices) | 2 episodes |- | 2015–present | ''[[F Is for Family]]'' | Kevin Murphy (voice) | 16 episodes |- | 2015 | ''[[Portlandia (TV series)|Portlandia]]'' | Justin | Episode: "The Fiancée" |- | 2015 | ''[[Inside Amy Schumer]]'' | Brian | Episode: "Fight Like a Girl" |- | 2015–18 | ''[[Drunk History]]'' | [[Arno Penzias]] / [[Elmer McCurdy]] | 2 episodes |- | 2016 | ''Dream Team'' | Marty Schumacher | Pilot |- | 2016–present | ''[[Skylanders Academy]]'' | [[Spyro the Dragon (character)|Spyro]] (voice) | Main role |- | 2017 | ''[[Do You Want To See a Dead Body?]]'' | Himself | Episode: "A Body and an Actor" |- |} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{commons category|Justin Long}} * {{IMDb name|0519043|Justin Long}} * [http://movies.about.com/library/weekly/blbreakupjl052206.htm Video interview with Justin Long] at the premiere of ''[[The Break-Up]]'' {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Long, Justin}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:American people of Sicilian descent]] [[Category:20th-century American male actors]] [[Category:21st-century American male actors]] [[Category:American male film actors]] [[Category:American male television actors]] [[Category:American male voice actors]] [[Category:Sacred Heart University faculty]] [[Category:Vassar College alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Male actors of Italian descent]] [[Category:Actors from Fairfield, Connecticut]] [[Category:Male actors from Connecticut]]
